general_notes.the_graph_subgraph: The Graph Subgraph API: Older public subgraphs (api.thegraph.com) may work without auth. Newer gateway (gateway.thegraph.com) typically requires API key. Free tier: ~1000 requests/hour per IP. Can be throttled if exceeded.

authentication.public_subgraphs: Older subgraphs on api.thegraph.com may work without authentication
authentication.gateway_subgraphs: Newer gateway.thegraph.com typically requires API key (free tier available)
authentication.uniswap_labs_api: Requires x-api-key header, free tier available with limits

pricing.most_subgraphs: Free tier available with rate limits
pricing.uniswap_routing: Free tier: 12 req/sec default, paid plans available
pricing.1inch: Free tier: 300 req/min, paid plans for higher limits

general_notes.recommendations: For production use, consider: 1) Getting API keys for The Graph Gateway if needed, 2) Implementing request throttling, 3) Caching responses, 4) Using WebSocket where available for real-time data, 5) Testing endpoints before production deployment
general_notes.warning: Rate limits and authentication requirements may change. Always check official documentation before production deployment. Some subgraphs may have migrated to gateway.thegraph.com requiring API keys.
